ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] How can this list be improved?
ygData.msgSnippet: You forgot to mention Magicians =) Very self sufficient with some decent damage spells and great pets ... From: Christina Norman
ygData.messageBody:
You forgot to mention Magicians =)

Very self sufficient with some decent damage spells and great pets


----- Original Message -----
From: "Christina Norman" <tina@...>
To: <EQ_women@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, June 30, 2000 5:08 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] How can this list be improved?


>
> Hey Sandy,
>
> I'm on Brell Serilis. Best class and race depends a lot on your playing
> style, they are all fun in different ways =)
>
> I'm in a guild called Rain which my ex-boyfriend runs (ack, we just broke
> up last week, I'm still not used to calling him my ex =( We are still
> friends but I don't know how things will work out for us and the guild in
> the long run.
>
> I have a level 54 enchanter. I love enchanters because they tend to act
> to alter combat more than to actually kill mobs. They mesmerise things,
> they speed things up, they slow things down, I guess I'm a bit of a
> control freak =) My enchanter is a female high elf named Luna. Enchanters
> are not much fun at low levels though. Most of their spells become more
> useful at high levels, at low levels they are mostly a waste of mana.
>
> I also have a level 52 wood elf rangers. Rangers are I think one of the
> most fun tank classes. They are very versatile. I'm finding at level 52
> that being a ranger isn't as fun as it used to be though, rangers seem to
> peak at around 40 I'd say.
>
> Tina
>
> Other fun classes:
> Bards, at low levels they are basicly tanks with neat abilities.
> They get healing song and speed song fairly early
> Druids, they get lots of fun spells fairly early, and are good for both
> grouping and soloing pretty much forever
> Necromancers, very powerful, and have lots of neat tricks. Pets are
> fun.
> Monks, don't need a lot of equipment, and very effective in battle.
> Fairly simple to play as well.
>
> On Fri, 30 Jun 2000, Sandy Wright wrote:
> > Tina,
> > I can only speak for myself, but as a newbie, there are lots of things I
would
> > like to see on this list.
> > First of all, what server everyone plays on and why?
> > What is the best class and race everyone has ever played?
> > Are you in a guild, which one, and any other guild info?
> > Stories about great RP adventures and worst mistakes.
> > General chatting and fun.
> >
> > I guess I will start with my basic info.
> > I play on the Torvonnilous server, mostly because it has the fewest
players
> > usually.
> > My current fav character is a lvl 5 Druid Woodelf named Linenu.
> > I usually play the 'good' characters vs. the 'evil' but i can see where
they
> > would be fun.
> > I have never tried the PvP servers, and probably won't.
> > I am not in a guild but would like to be someday.
> > Latest fun-last night I played for over 6 hours on and around Orc hill
with 3
> > other char. Kicked some major Orc booty! and had fun talking and
flirting
> > with the guys in my group. (I was the only woman!)
> > Biggest mistake (so far!)-not putting all my ability points into Wisdom
for my
> > Druid when I started this character.
> > In Real Life, I am a Kindergarten teacher in her late 30's. My 15 year
old
> > son is the one who started this game and then got me hooked. Since I am
out
> > of school for the summer, I have lots of time to play. I don't know
what I
> > will do in August when I go back to work!! I wonder if I can play EQ
during
> > recess and lunch???!!! lol
> > I hope to hear from others on this list.
> >
> >
> >
> > --
> > Sandy-
> > ICQ- #9462081
> > AIM- SandyW62
